contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Nihongo|'''Ume'''|宇目町|Ume-machi}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Minamiamabe District, Ōita|Minamiamabe District]], [[Ōita Prefecture|Ōita]], [[Japan]]. On March 3, 2005 Ume, along with the towns of [[Kamae, Ōita|Kamae]], [[Kamiura, Ōita|Kamiura]], [[Tsurumi, Ōita|Tsurumi]] and [[Yayoi, Ōita|Yayoi]], and the villages of [[Honjō, Ōita|Honjō]], [[Naokawa, Ōita|Naokawa]] and [[Yonōzu, Ōita|Yonōzu]], all from [[Minamiamabe District, Ōita|Minamiamabe District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Saiki, Ōita|Saiki]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 3,529 and the [[population density|density]] of 13.27 persons per km². The total area was 265.99 km². Ume is famous for its [[My Neighbor Totoro|Totoro]] [[bus stop]]{{cn|date=February 2012}}. {{DEFAULTSORT:Ume, Oita}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ōita Prefecture]] {{Oita-geo-stub}}
